item.title: On Code Reviews and Git Commit Messages
item.description: Can you tell what the commits in the following screenshot do? They introduce changes to code, but in order to understand them and be able to perform a code review, you’d need to dig deep into the changes themselves, build up the context around them, hunt through files, and try to link everything together. In your head. You’ll waste precious mental resources trying to re-establish the context and understand the scope of the changes.
